data.name: Foxes and rabbits
data.description:
The year is Year 0. 

You have a field, with a number of rabbits and foxes in it.

In the spring of each coming year the rabbit population will double in size.
Also, the fox population will increase in size by 50%. This should be to a whole number, decimals should be floored.
Over the Summer each fox will eat one rabbit, or all of them if there are less rabbits than foxes.
During Autumn, hunters will kill 20 foxes, or all of them if there are less than 20.



You will make a function that takes in the initial number of foxes and rabbits.

The function will run until either:

 the population of foxes and rabbits exceeds 1000,
 in which case it will return

	"The population is out of control. Year X"

 or there are no more rabbits
 
	"All rabbits were eaten. Year X"

 or there are no more foxes
 
	"Foxes hunted to extinction. Year X"

The X should be replaced with the correct year number.


If the initial amount of foxes or rabbits is less than 0, or the total is over 1000, Year X will be year 0.



EXAMPLE

Year 0 

Initial amounts

	101 foxes, 101 rabbits.

Year 1

Fox population increases by 50% and rabbit population doubles.

	  151 foxes, 202 rabbits

Each fox eats one rabbit

    51 rabbits

20 foxes are hunted

    131 foxes
    
There are still foxes and rabbits, and less than 1000 animals in total, so we progress to the next year.

Year 2

Fox population increases by 50% and rabbit population doubles.

    196 foxes, 102 rabbits

Each fox eats one rabbit...
 
	"All rabbits were eaten. Year 2"
